hero.headline: YouTube Thumbnail A/B Testing
hero.subheadline: Test, measure, improve. Data-driven thumbnail optimization.

sections.content: A 2% CTR improvement can double your video's reach. Thumbnail A/B testing removes guesswork—let data decide what works. YouTube's native test feature (in limited rollout) and manual testing methods help you optimize every thumbnail based on actual viewer behavior.

faq.question: How long should I run each test?
faq.answer: Minimum 7 days, ideally 14. Need enough impressions for statistical significance. Low-view videos need longer test periods.

faq.question: Does YouTube have official A/B testing?
faq.answer: Yes—Test & Compare feature rolling out. Check YouTube Studio > Video > Analytics for availability. Not all channels have access yet.

faq.question: Can testing hurt my video?
faq.answer: Short-term CTR may fluctuate. Worst case is temporary lower CTR during poor variant. Long-term benefits outweigh short-term risk.

faq.question: How do I know if results are significant?
faq.answer: Look for 10%+ CTR difference with 1000+ impressions. Smaller differences may be noise. Use online statistical significance calculators if unsure.
